attributes.action: Ensure that Peter Crouch is selected for the England World Cup squad
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Peter Crouch is at risk of not being selected for the world cup squad, regardless of his epic 2 goal contribution to the win against Egypt on 2nd March having been brought on as a substitute in the second half. Here are the facts which support Crouch's right to be selected:

1. Crouch’s England goal record is 20 in 37 internationals. He’s been on the winning side on 24 occasions.

2. Of his 37 caps, only 17 have been starts, two of which came in the opening games of the 2006 World Cup finals in Germany.

3. England have won 12 of the previous 13 matches in which Crouch has scored. 

4. He has now scored six goals in his past five England appearances.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the FA and the England Manager.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
